message:
Command `bash -lc "cat > check_solution.py << 'PY'
import subprocess
import sys

def run_test(input_s: str):
    p = subprocess.Popen(['python3', 'solution.py'], stdin=subprocess.PIPE, stdout=subprocess.PIPE, stderr=subprocess.PIPE, text=True)
    out, err = p.communicate(input_s)
    return p.returncode, out, err

# Sample tests from prompt
tests = [
    ("6 5\n1 1 1 2 2 3\n1 2\n6 4\n5 1\n3 6\n4 6\n", "1\n2\n1\n1\n3\n"),
    ("5 3\n2 4 2 4 2\n3 1\n2 5\n3 2\n", "1\n2\n0\n"),
]

all_ok = True
for i, (inp, expected) in enumerate(tests, 1):
    rc, out, err = run_test(inp)
    ok = out == expected
    print(f"Test {i}: rc={rc}, ok={ok}")
    if not ok:
        print('Expected:')
        print(expected)
        print('Got:')
        print(out)
        print('Err:')
        print(err)
        all_ok = False

# Additional random tests
import random

def brute_force_solution(N, colors, queries):
    boxes = [[] for _ in range(N+1)]
    for i,c in enumerate(colors,1):
        boxes[i].append(c)
    outputs = []
    for a,b in queries:
        boxes[b].extend(boxes[a])
        boxes[a] = []
        outputs.append(len(set(boxes[b])))
    return outputs

for t in range(20):
    N = random.randint(1, 10)
    Q = random.randint(1, 20)
    colors = [random.randint(1, N) for _ in range(N)]
    queries = [(random.randint(1,N), random.randint(1,N)) for _ in range(Q)]
    # ensure a != b
    queries = [(a,b if b!=a else ((b % N)+1)) for a,b in queries]
    inp = f"{N} {Q}\n" + ' '.join(map(str,colors)) + '\n'
    for a,b in queries:
        inp += f"{a} {b}\n"
    rc, out, err = run_test(inp)
    out_lines = out.strip().splitlines()
    expected = brute_force_solution(N, colors, queries)
    out_nums = list(map(int, out_lines)) if out_lines[0]!='' else []
    if out_nums != expected:
        print('Random test failed')
        print('N=',N,'Q=',Q)
        print('colors=',colors)
        print('queries=',queries)
        print('expected=',expected)
        print('got=',out_nums)
        all_ok = False
        break

print('ALL OK' if all_ok else 'SOME FAIL')
PY"` executed with exit code 0.

import subprocess
import sys

def run_test(input_s: str):

# Sample tests from prompt
tests = [
    ("6 5\n1 1 1 2 2 3\n1 2\n6 4\n5 1\n3 6\n4 6\n", "1\n2\n1\n1\n3\n"),
    ("5 3\n2 4 2 4 2\n3 1\n2 5\n3 2\n", "1\n2\n0\n"),
]

all_ok = True
for i, (inp, expected) in enumerate(tests, 1):
    rc, out, err = run_test(inp)
    ok = out == expected
    print(f"Test {i}: rc={rc}, ok={ok}")
    if not ok:

import random

def brute_force_solution(N, colors, queries):
    boxes = [[] for _ in range(N+1)]
    for i,c in enumerate(colors,1):
        boxes[i].append(c)
    outputs = []
    for a,b in queries:
        boxes[b].extend(boxes[a])
        boxes[a] = []
        outputs.append(len(set(boxes[b])))
    return outputs

for t in range(20):
    N = random.randint(1, 10)
    Q = random.randint(1, 20)
    colors = [random.randint(1, N) for _ in range(N)]
    queries = [(random.randint(1,N), random.randint(1,N)) for _ in range(Q)]
    # ensure a != b
    queries = [(a,b if b!=a else ((b % N)+1)) for a,b in queries]
    inp = f"{N} {Q}\n" + ' '.join(map(str,colors)) + '\n'
    for a,b in queries:
        inp += f"{a} {b}\n"

    out_lines = out.strip().splitlines()

    out_nums = list(map(int, out_lines)) if out_lines[0]!='' else []

        print('Random test failed')
        print('N=',N,'Q=',Q)
        print('colors=',colors)
        print('queries=',queries)
        print('expected=',expected)
        print('got=',out_nums)
        all_ok = False
        break

print('ALL OK' if all_ok else 'SOME FAIL')

bash -lc "cat > check_solution.py << 'PY'
import subprocess
import sys
def run_test(input_s: str):
    p = subprocess.Popen(['python3', 'solution.py'], stdin=subprocess.PIPE, stdout=subprocess.PIPE, stderr=subprocess.PIPE, text=True)
    out, err = p.communicate(input_s)
    return p.returncode, out, err
# Sample tests from prompt
tests = [
    ("6 5\n1 1 1 2 2 3\n1 2\n6 4\n5 1\n3 6\n4 6\n", "1\n2\n1\n1\n3\n"),
    ("5 3\n2 4 2 4 2\n3 1\n2 5\n3 2\n", "1\n2\n0\n"),
]
all_ok = True
for i, (inp, expected) in enumerate(tests, 1):
    rc, out, err = run_test(inp)
    ok = out == expected
    print(f"Test {i}: rc={rc}, ok={ok}")
    if not ok:
        print('Expected:')
        print(expected)
        print('Got:')
        print(out)
        print('Err:')
        print(err)
        all_ok = False
# Additional random tests
import random
def brute_force_solution(N, colors, queries):
    boxes = [[] for _ in range(N+1)]
    for i,c in enumerate(colors,1):
        boxes[i].append(c)
    outputs = []
    for a,b in queries:
        boxes[b].extend(boxes[a])
        boxes[a] = []
        outputs.append(len(set(boxes[b])))
    return outputs
for t in range(20):
    N = random.randint(1, 10)
    Q = random.randint(1, 20)
    colors = [random.randint(1, N) for _ in range(N)]
    queries = [(random.randint(1,N), random.randint(1,N)) for _ in range(Q)]
    # ensure a != b
    queries = [(a,b if b!=a else ((b % N)+1)) for a,b in queries]
    inp = f"{N} {Q}\n" + ' '.join(map(str,colors)) + '\n'
    for a,b in queries:
        inp += f"{a} {b}\n"
    rc, out, err = run_test(inp)
    out_lines = out.strip().splitlines()
    expected = brute_force_solution(N, colors, queries)
    out_nums = list(map(int, out_lines)) if out_lines[0]!='' else []
    if out_nums != expected:
        print('Random test failed')
        print('N=',N,'Q=',Q)
        print('colors=',colors)
        print('queries=',queries)
        print('expected=',expected)
        print('got=',out_nums)
        all_ok = False
        break
print('ALL OK' if all_ok else 'SOME FAIL')

bash -lc "cat > check_solution.py << 'PY'
import subprocess
import sys

def run_test(input_s: str):
    p = subprocess.Popen(['python3', 'solution.py'], stdin=subprocess.PIPE, stdout=subprocess.PIPE, stderr=subprocess.PIPE, text=True)
    out, err = p.communicate(input_s)
    return p.returncode, out, err

# Sample tests from prompt
tests = [
    ("6 5\n1 1 1 2 2 3\n1 2\n6 4\n5 1\n3 6\n4 6\n", "1\n2\n1\n1\n3\n"),
    ("5 3\n2 4 2 4 2\n3 1\n2 5\n3 2\n", "1\n2\n0\n"),
]

all_ok = True
for i, (inp, expected) in enumerate(tests, 1):
    rc, out, err = run_test(inp)
    ok = out == expected
    print(f"Test {i}: rc={rc}, ok={ok}")
    if not ok:
        print('Expected:')
        print(expected)
        print('Got:')
        print(out)
        print('Err:')
        print(err)
        all_ok = False

# Additional random tests
import random

def brute_force_solution(N, colors, queries):
    boxes = [[] for _ in range(N+1)]
    for i,c in enumerate(colors,1):
        boxes[i].append(c)
    outputs = []
    for a,b in queries:
        boxes[b].extend(boxes[a])
        boxes[a] = []
        outputs.append(len(set(boxes[b])))
    return outputs

for t in range(20):
    N = random.randint(1, 10)
    Q = random.randint(1, 20)
    colors = [random.randint(1, N) for _ in range(N)]
    queries = [(random.randint(1,N), random.randint(1,N)) for _ in range(Q)]
    # ensure a != b
    queries = [(a,b if b!=a else ((b % N)+1)) for a,b in queries]
    inp = f"{N} {Q}\n" + ' '.join(map(str,colors)) + '\n'
    for a,b in queries:
        inp += f"{a} {b}\n"
    rc, out, err = run_test(inp)
    out_lines = out.strip().splitlines()
    expected = brute_force_solution(N, colors, queries)
    out_nums = list(map(int, out_lines)) if out_lines[0]!='' else []
    if out_nums != expected:
        print('Random test failed')
        print('N=',N,'Q=',Q)
        print('colors=',colors)
        print('queries=',queries)
        print('expected=',expected)
        print('got=',out_nums)
        all_ok = False
        break

print('ALL OK' if all_ok else 'SOME FAIL')
